meanings.sent1: The tea had a bitterish flavor that lingered on my tongue.
meanings.sent2: The medicine left a bitterish aftertaste in my mouth.
meanings.sent3: The bitterish coffee made me scrunch up my face in mock disgust.
meanings.sent4: Her bitterish remarks stung more than expected.
meanings.sent5: The bitterish chocolate reminded me of unsweetened cocoa.

meanings.sent1: The salad dressing had a bitterish tang that complemented the greens.
meanings.sent2: The beer had a bitterish taste that some people enjoy.
meanings.sent3: She made a bitterish face after tasting the lemonade with too much rind.
meanings.sent4: The bitterish undertone of the dish added depth to the overall flavor.
meanings.sent5: The bitterish herbs gave the soup a unique and interesting twist.

meanings.definition: Tending to be bitter in nature.
meanings.sent1: His bitterish attitude made it hard to have a pleasant conversation.
meanings.sent2: The bitterish relationship between the two countries led to tension.
meanings.sent3: The bitterish rivalry between the teams made the game more intense.
meanings.sent4: The bitterish memories of the past haunted her dreams.
meanings.sent5: The bitterish tone of the meeting hinted at underlying conflicts.
